a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Tax revenues as a share of GDP vs. income inequality, 2023

Taxes include direct and indirect taxes as well as social contributions. The
Gini coefficient
measures inequality
on a scale from 0 to 1. Higher values indicate higher inequality.
Data source: UNU-WIDER Government Revenue Dataset (2023); World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform (2024)

Note: Depending on the country and year, inequality data relates to income measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption,
per capita
.
